title: Riot is basically killing AP Mages in mid
body:
As a mid lane main (preferably a control or siege mage) Riot is essentially killing the ability to survive in mid as a mage against an ad assassin. Athene's has been made to be used on only AP champs that have sheild's (yay for a lux and ori buff that was definitely needed. kappa). Zhonyas has been lowered in price, lowered the AP received from it, increased the CD of the active (zed can now ult you again before its up) while giving us 10% CDR. So our one Armour item that was somewhat viable against AD assassins (or even AP assassins) is now less viable because it's weaker and its active is now on a longer cooldown. Thank you Riot, when we said we wanted more AP options we didn't want a rocket belt, we wanted another Amour item that also gives us combat stats...

The recent dialogue involving itemization has been about 'magnifying strengths **and** weaknesses', so why then did all of the marksman itemization changes magnify their strengths _and gloss over their weaknesses_? AD champions (specifically marksmen) have crit, lifesteal, attack speed, and attack damage. Mages get ability power, ~~mana regen~~ (rip), and cdr. But wait, AD champions have Essence Reaver. And Black Cleaver. And Death's Dance. And Trinity Force. And Ghostblade. Meanwhile mages can't take advantage of any 'AD' stats but marksmen can have unlimited mana and maxed cdr from two items _that also give attack damage and crit chance_. AD champions have the advantage taking dragons, baron, AND turrets. AD champions can deal damage with basic attacks AND abilities. Mages only have their abilities. Mages have waveclear? Build SS and one-shot minion waves. AD champions can build defensively without much penalty (QSS build/Maw + many AD items grant health/lifesteal/anti-burst). Meanwhile Zhonya's active is getting nerfed. 

Need a dispel? Build QSS! AP? Better take {{summoner:1}}  and lose a summoner.

**Lanes**: AD can go top lane (bruisers/tanks), mid lane (assassins), jungle (dominated by AD. Runic Echoes ends up being abused by champions it wasn't even intended for; Udyr, Hecarim), and bot (marksmen). Mages? Mid...support _kinda_. Maybe top if you get a cheese match up?

**Keystone masteries**: Warlords? AD. Fervor? AD. Deathfire Touch, the arguably 'for ap' mastery of this tier, is absolute garbage on all but Cassiopeia or Malzahar and sees most of its use on, you guessed it, AD champions; Jhin and Varus. Not only because it scales _way_ better with AD, but also because it's heavily nerfed for AoE effects **which is most mage abilities** by default. Stormraiders? Assassins. Then you have the Tenacity tree which is for tanks, but can be used by AD champions (specifically bruisers) to great success. The only option really is Thunderlords.

Why can a marksman have infinite sustain, unlimited mana, max cdr, damage, attack speed, crit, and more** in the same build** while mages get sub-optimal build paths to buy their sole, one dimensional, counter item? And we wonder why we have quadruple AD teams, often triple marksmen, and Rammus flew out into the meta faster than a homeguarded Quinn. Plenty of marksmen bring teamfight/cleave damage (_cough_ Sivir _cough_) and tanks bring plenty of CC. You pretty much only bring a mage out of necessity for an AP threat. Proof? When the enemy team has no tanks you put an AD champion in **every** position.

The itemization for AD is just flat out better. AD is more versatile and its items are more loaded with stats and effects. These changes benefit one-kill rotation AP champions and AP tanks; neither of which needed any help. Traditional mages needed more options, more variety in itemization and power spikes, not _more _ restrictions in a meta that already strangles them.

I suppose it's too early to tell what with the updates coming. Who knows, maybe mages will be broken OP. But when they released the AD item changes it made more stats more readily available to AD champions. That's not what these changes appear to be for AP champions, and that makes me sad.
